instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , I am missing LCD BKLT EN,  It comes from GMUX <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>
threads.message:
Could someone help me with what to do next?
I am working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. It’s a MacBook Pro 17”
I have display as confirmed bu chipmunk USB tester. I am missing LCD BKLT EN. It comes from GMUX <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>
If it’s not present, anything I can do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , I am missing LCD BKLT EN,  It comes from GMUX <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>
threads.message:
So you get internal image for sure, only missing backlight?
Any history available?
Did someone try to disable the GPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , I am missing LCD BKLT EN,  It comes from GMUX <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>
threads.message: I am not sure how to disable GPU ? The board came from another shop and they already have a jumper for <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , I am missing LCD BKLT EN,  It comes from GMUX <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>
threads.message:
If someone tried disabling GPU in wrong manner, that can be the cause.
For example, disabling it in BIOS; doesn't resist to PRAM reset.

"So you get internal image for sure, only missing backlight?"
